Author: ph03nix#3115
Content:
i have a pos64 question...let's say i have 64000 COIN

which is it better to do...

1 UTXO of 1000 in 64 segids
10 UTXOs of 100 in 64 segids
100 UTXOs of 10 in 64 segids

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Hi  @ph03nix üëã
There are a few different strategies out there.  I haven't tested anything seriously yet, so have just been using a combination.
Also keen to hear what others have to say.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @ph03nix you need to think about "will this UTXO stake within 1 month?"

Author: Alright#0419
Content: then make as many of that size as possible

Author: Alright#0419
Content: 1 month is the age cap, so after that it doesn't become more likely to stake

Author: Alright#0419
Content: takes a bit of stats gathering and intuition to find a good size

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: thank you ü§î

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: how would you determine if an UTXO will stake within a month?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: previous staking stats and intuition

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: alrighty üëç

I have merged the entire LABS current master to here :https://github.com/zuluplatform/komodo/pull/2
If anything happens to it. And anyone is looking for any commits it should be here. Wont be touching it yet, as I need to get 0BR notary pay sorted still. 
We should be able to run the current chains on FSM branch of my KMD fork. Started a new branch there called `newLABS` 
I will be porting the notarypay 0BR stuff there and hopefully getting it to work without reindex.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:

Once the tokens stuff and gateways stuff has been sorted out by dimxy and its merged to FSM, I will bring it to my new branch. And we can wipe out the cluster and start some LABS testnet chains for heavy testing ready for launch ü§û

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Hello guys, if I am elected as NN operator, I'd like to help and support you. As I wrote "Additional server for kmdlabs for testing (details to be discussed)" in my proposal, I'd like to discuss a little bit the details

Author: phm87#7395
Content: To be short I was thinking about using TeamCity on the server pointing to the sources repos that you want with automated integration. I played a little bit with docker but I'm noob with it and I think that you're using it.

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Another idea would be to pay a smaller server for kmdlabs and give some amount of KMD to support financially. Currently, I'm having a lot of fun on the 2019 NN testnet. Alright said to me that kmdlabs is an incentivited testnet of notarizations

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: @phm87 mostly we have a sever or two each to notarise and test things. LABs is kind of like testnet but not just ranked by notaristaion count. Chains being notarised change more often, and specific things get tested like fungible cluster coin migrations. We get the new things and try and break them üòÉ

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: In terms of funding support, a few ideas have been mentioned but I'm not sure anything is difinitive just yet. Bounties for testing stuff, finding where and how it breaks and also working on the fix are pretty important

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: Things like maintaining the website, organising the admin side of tests and payments, and probably also some docs for reference to let more get involved are also important.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: Bounties can be offered for any of the above, and there is also a multisig address that can be contributed to which will be used to fund bounties as determined/proposed and vote on by signatories and the community

Author: gt#2812
Content: also a fund for KMD notarizing

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
